Friends

class QtArgCmdLine

Detailed Description

Interface of the argument.

Should be implemented by every class wanted to be an argument.

virtual bool QtArgIface::isRequired (  )  const [pure virtual]

Returns:
Is this argument required?
Return values:
true if argument is required.
false if argument isn't required.

Implemented in QtArg, and QtXorArg.

virtual bool QtArgIface::isDefined (  )  const [pure virtual]

Returns:
Is this argument defined in command line?
Return values:
true if argument has decided he has been defined.
false if argument hasn't decided he has been defined.

Implemented in QtArg, and QtXorArg.

false if this argument shouldn't have a value.

Implemented in QtArg, and QtXorArg.

virtual QtArgIface* QtArgIface::giveArgument ( const QChar &  flag  )  [pure virtual]

Should return pointer to the QtArgIface if this argument know how to do it, usually returns "this" if he does.

If this argument handles another arguments with flag flag than he should return pointer to this argument.

Return values:
Pointer to the QtArgIface if flag flag determines this argument.
NULL if flag flag doesn't determine this argument.
Parameters:
flag  Is a flag that returned argument should own. If this argument doesn't own this flag or sub-arguments don't own this flag then returned value should be null-pointer.

Implemented in QtArg, and QtXorArg.

virtual QtArgIface* QtArgIface::giveArgument ( const QString &  name  )  [pure virtual]

Should return pointer to the QtArgIface if this argument know how to do it, usually returns "this" if he does.

If this argument handles another arguments with name name than he should return pointer to this argument.

Return values:
Pointer to the QtArgIface if name name determines this argument.
NULL if name name doesn't determine this argument.
Parameters:
name  Is a name that returned argument should own. If this argument doesn't own this name or sub-arguments don't own this name then returned value should be null-pointer.

Implemented in QtArg, and QtXorArg.

virtual const QtArgCmdLineIface::QtArgumentsList& QtArgIface::arguments (  )  const [pure virtual]

Usually returns list with "this" pointer or list with all handled arguments.

Returns:
List of the arguments handled by this argument.

Implemented in QtArg, and QtXorArg.

virtual void QtArgIface::checkConstraint (  )  const [pure virtual]

Check correctness of the argument constraint.

Exceptions:
QtArgContraintNotObservedEx if constraint didn't observed.

Implemented in QtArg, QtMultiArg, and QtXorArg.

QString QtArgIface::getUsageString ( const NamesList &  namesList  )  const [inline, virtual]

Should return "USAGE" string for this argument.

For example: "-a%afterFlags%--arg %value%", where "%value%" is QtArgHelpPrinterIface::argValue and "%afterFlags%" is QtArgHelpPrinterIface::afterFlags.

Returns:
"USAGE" string for this argument.
Parameters:
namesList  Names of all available arguments.

QString QtArgIface::getHelpString ( const NamesList &  namesList  )  const [inline, virtual]

Should return "HELP" string for this argument.

For spaces you have to use string constants from QtArgHelpPrinterIface interface.

Returns:
"HELP" string for this argument.
Parameters:
namesList  Names of all available arguments.

virtual int QtArgIface::process ( QtArgCmdLineContext &  context  )  [protected, pure virtual]

Process argument.

Can throw exceptions.

Returns:
The number of processed arguments.
Parameters:
context  Command line context.

Implemented in QtArg, QtMultiArg, and QtXorArg.

context  Command line context.
